<br />
Class in a bottle<br />
<br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1456825"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1456825#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1449804" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1449804" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="A.Bandini"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1250056.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="A.Bandini" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pierre-Guillaume-Paris/Bois-Naufrage-16-1-8356.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8356.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois Naufrage 16.1"title="Bois Naufrage 16.1"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1449804ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1449804" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250056">A.Bandini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-21">11/21/21 08:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An overload of heavily spicy and overly sweet notes that make sure this one is neither fresh nor an option as a fougere. I could never get along with this one. Its mature and as someone who doesnt like honey in fragrances, i cant appreciate that lingering honey accord underneath which never disappears. I dont accept this one as a fougere to be honest. Neither the notes nor the smell qualify this one for that category. Its not clean and fresh enough to be considered a fougere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1449804"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1449804#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1443315" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1443315" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ravenna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1360311.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ravenna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1443315ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1443315" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311">ravenna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-10">11/10/21 03:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It took me 3 wears to figure out what to write about this scent. Upon spraying the citrus/soapy metallic is very distinct yet unappealing, and when I put my arm down I instantly forget I'm wearing it. Many are also saying it's a skin scent which is a shame- when I put my nose to it after it dries down I love what I smell, but I literally cannot breathe in enough to form a coherent opinion LOL.<br />
<br />
In an office setting this fragrance would be borderline salacious which I love. Outdoors though, it's just another fougere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1443315"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1443315#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1441880" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1441880" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fromthebayandaroundtheway"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1047408.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fromthebayandaroundtheway" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1441880ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1441880" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047408">fromthebayandaroundtheway</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-07">11/07/21 13:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A story is definitely told with Sartorial. Monsieur Duchaufour has put his creative wizardry on full display. This is a magical fougere that adds a new wrinkle to the genre. Imagine that typical sweet powdery finish of a barbershop style fragrance with an added layer of steam and a subtle wax, like a freshly pressed suit. That simple, little olfactory trick distinguishes, Sartorial as not just another barbershop fragrance. <br />
Sartorial gets worn when you wake up with a purpose and that purpose is dressing up and showing out! Think a three piece suit or just something you've been planning to wear and you know you will standout. Sartorial is the final touch to that eccentric outfit your rocking!  As for the scent, well the aldehydes, metallic notes and the beeswax are the standouts for me. The use of linden blossom helps tame the lavender and prop up the honey, tonka powdery finish. Yes, the dry down does that perfect powdery effect of a barber brushing you off after a fresh cut to perfection! Then just imagine that powdery finish juxtaposed with freshly pressed linens and voila! Sartorial! <br />
Sartorial is a throw back scent that you need to finesse when you wear it. It can be challenging. This is a fragrance that could be worn in the office, and could be worn day or night, but day suits it best. I wouldn't consider Sartorial a date night fragrance, nor a hanging out with friends scent either. Sartorial lends mostly to formal affairs especially when you want to come off as serious, or if you're aiming to make an impression. This is a fragrance that is for the 30 and up crowd and definitely veers more masculine. Give Sartorial a few sprays when, well ... I'll leave this to Bill Cunnignham, when "Fashion is the armor to survive the reality of everyday life."</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1441880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1441880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1441018" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1441018" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lilacs&amp;Lavender"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1109580"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1109580.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lilacs&amp;Lavender" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Alexandria-II-Anniversary-89904.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89904.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alexandria II Anniversary"title="Alexandria II Anniversary"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1441018ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1441018" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1109580">Lilacs&amp;Lavender</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-06">11/06/21 02:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is allegedly inspired by the needles and thread which are lubricated with beeswax when sewing Saville Row bespoke garments. Whether that’s what actually inspired the nose, or simply clever marketing, Sartorial does in fact remind me of the expert craft of hand sewing.<br />
<br />
Now onto less esoteric matters… Sartorial is more complex than it appears when you smell it initially. Just look at the note structure. Mind you, half of these aren’t apparent to me, but that’s not to say you won’t pick them up and enjoy notes which hide from me. At the start, I do love the freshness of the aldehydes, citrus and spices, which are soon smoothed out by the beeswax and honey. Lavender stays with me all the way through and unlike other wearers, I don’t have a problem with longevity. Perhaps because I always manage to get a bit on my clothing. That’s fitting for a fragrance inspired by tailoring. How many puns can I work into this review?<br />
<br />
I like to wear Sartorial when I’m after a clean, fresh fragrance when leaving home for the day, but appreciate that it then morphs into a subtle fragrance with some gravitas. You can be taken seriously wearing Sartorial. For me, this is entirely suitable for the office and then on into the evening.<br />
<br />
Sartorial might be described as an updated barbershop scent, yet I’m a woman and wear this, so please don’t fall for the “masculine fragrance” limiting box and miss out on an entire genre of wonderful fragrances. Sample widely and what you enjoy. <br />
<br />
In short, Sartorial is elegant perfection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1441018"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1441018#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1433147" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1433147" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DingoDirk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396467"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="DingoDirk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1433147ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1433147" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396467">DingoDirk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-23">10/23/21 06:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought it at half price directly from Penhaligon's in a "no box" included sale.<br />
<br />
I'm glad I didn't pay full price. Performance and sillage are very bad for me: a skin scent within 30 minutes.<br />
<br />
Lavender, cardamom, ginger and generally spicy but the spices are flattened by a soapy clean overtone of subtle honey and big aldehyde but not obviously sweet smelling. I guess it's cleverly blended. <br />
<br />
Smells soapy fresh to me with the spices becoming more prominent in the dry down in a powdery way that still has depth. <br />
<br />
In terms of spice it's much more subtle and green than Spicebomb Extreme and is definitely very safe for office use. <br />
<br />
I suppose it's a technically skilled creation in terms of the balanced and complex overall smell but the performance is not good and on that basis alone I certainly don't plan to buy another bottle.<br />
<br />
That said, it does have a classy smell that stands out in my collection. Bleu de Chanel is definitely more impressive in terms of high class impact but Sartorial is a more complex fragrance and also more subtle carrying off an expensive soapy fresh, subtle lavender and spicy effect.<br />
<br />
It reminds me of the smell of a travel bag or suitcase following a stay in an expensive hotel - an experience I have had only a once or twice in my life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1433147"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1433147#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1431500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1431500" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marcjohn86"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250281"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1250281.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marcjohn86" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/La-Nuit-de-l-Homme-5521.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5521.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Nuit de l'Homme"title="La Nuit de l'Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1431500ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1431500" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250281">Marcjohn86</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-20">10/20/21 12:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just a two cents worth for what I've experienced thus far: I really like it, it's a very traditional barbershop fragrance but it's also very much in the modern style. Whereas older, more dated barbershop fragrances that I've smelled are typically quite synthetic smelling and they oftentimes are pretty linear or basic smelling I would say, this one has little nuances that take it from "this is the modern Brut" to being it's own thing and less of a B-tier fragrance to being potentially an A or S tier fragrance! I love this thing!<br />
<br />
It's resinous, powdery, slightly warm and cozy and has a nice touch of sweetness and spice. It's what you would expect from a barbershop fragrance so it doesn't really break the mold and do something especially new, but it does it at such a high level that it's difficult for me not to be impressed. To compare it to something, I'd say it's like if you made Brut but instead of needing to sell it at $15 a bottle, the creator of this spared no expense because it's a fragrance that retails at over $150. So, it's basically 10x the price, and I think the quality reflects that and I think it's worth that but maybe get it from a discounter and save about $50, because I think you can get it for closer to $100-120 if you know where to look.<br />
<br />
No opinion yet on performance, it's lasting so far pretty decently and I'm getting wafts of it about 4 hours after initial application, but I have to really use it several time to gage that accurately. I would say that the projection and sillage are both moderate, it's pretty subtle and I don't think it flies off of your skin but I could have gone noseblind to it. Again, I'll need to do several wearings to really tell how long it's going to last.<br />
<br />
I would call it a masculine fragrance for sure, but it's something anyone could wear if they wanted to and they like barbershop, classical masculine styles like Brut, Rive Gauche Pour Homme, Azzaro Pour Homme, etc. and I would also recommend it for everyday use. This is an ideal signature scent for the day time, very good office scent IMO.<br />
<br />
I'll have to do an update after I've had it for a bit longer, but this seems like a winner for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1431500"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1431500#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1427349" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1427349" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="easterncrescent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/472121"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.472121.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="easterncrescent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1427349ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1427349" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/472121">easterncrescent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-13">10/13/21 07:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is wonderful and is a very classic barbershop sent. In essence it is a smooth lavender heavy fragrance with a metallic edge but with some underlying warmth (presumably the beeswax). Tragedy is however that I cannot purchase the full bottle because the performance is crushingly disappointing. The opening is fantastic but the projection fades away within half an hour and so do the base notes to my nose leaving just a skin scent of sharp top notes. Side-by-side with something like Rive Gauche it makes me very sad as, whilst RG powers on, poor sartorial becomes impotent pretty rapidly. This could have been so great but for the performance (considering the high price).<br />
<br />
Edit: I did eventually fall for this one as the opening is so powerful and even the dry down impressive I just needed to buy it. I just miss the opening so much when it’s gone… hence my complaining about longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1427349"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1427349#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1413178" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1413178" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mr45"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250222"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1250222.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mr45" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Zara-W-END-till-3-00-AM-39158.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39158.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Zara W/END till 3:00 AM"title="Zara W/END till 3:00 AM"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1413178ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1413178" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250222">Mr45</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-19">09/19/21 05:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Strange...everyone keeps saying they smell the notes listed. What I get from mine (bought from FragranceX in 2020) is a very traditional barbershop scent, no lavender or waternote.  On my nose and skin, I get spices, predominantly cumin and cloves, that is sweet and warm with a powdery feel. Got to get a fresh bottle from Pengaligon's itself to compare with the juice in my current bottle.<br />
<br />
Anyone else has such an experience?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1413178"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1413178#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1394642" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1394642" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thanasis_87k"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thanasis_87k" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Viking-41698.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41698.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Viking"title="Viking"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1394642ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1394642" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361577">Thanasis_87k</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-18">08/18/21 15:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I see the notes and the main accords above and I am puzzled. On my skin and nose, it smells a bit green, reminding me of wet-cut grass. However, I get the sense of what other commenters mentioned about dry cleaned folded white shirt (steamy perception)<br />
I feel the scent evolves rather linear. I would rather smell it on men 100%. Amazing longevity for an edt, however is a perfume for Alfred, not Bruce Wayne. "Inoffensive" office fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1394642"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1394642#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1374106" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
