If so...thats a SHAME</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1063360"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1063360#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1060079" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1060079" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chrisk252"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="chrisk252" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cerruti/1881-Men-329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1881 Men"title="1881 Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1060079ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1060079" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-13">05/13/19 16:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hint of Brut and generally fougere like but also very distinct. Green, slightly sweet, warm. Maybe a sweeter, friendlier YSL Rive Gauche? Might be a buy. 9/10<br />
<br />
EDIT 6/14/2022: Dug out the bottle and tried it after about 2 years of ignoring it and man, it's goooood. I'm getting a lot more honey than I remember, but overall like a very proper British YSL Rive Gauche and Brut but with more honey and a distinctly British vibe. Feels like I'm in the Downton Abbey library reading a leather covered book. Very nice...will be wearing more.<br />
<br />
Scent: 8 / Sillage: 7 / Longevity: 7</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1060079"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1060079#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1047903" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1047903" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bubbagump210"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1067648"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bubbagump210" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1047903ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1047903" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1067648">bubbagump210</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-04">04/04/19 12:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I say this is probably tied with Rive Gauche as the best barbershop scent out there. Where as Rive Gauche leans more herbal and lavender, Sartorial leans more tonka and oak moss. Yes, it does remind me or Brut - but Crane Lake Cabernet reminds me of a Bordeaux too. That doesn’t mean they are the same thing. The references to At the Barbershop are off base. At the Barbershop wants to be a Rive Gauche, not this. Also, I find the base of MMM fragrances terribly cheap and plastic smelling... not a worthy comparison to Rive Gauche or Sartorial.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1047903"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1047903#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1045187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1045187" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alanwake"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174422"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1174422.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alanwake" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mad-et-Len/Paname-40981.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40981.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paname"title="Paname"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1045187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1045187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174422">alanwake</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-27">03/27/19 08:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sartorial is slightly sharp in the opening but soon settles, the scent becomes smooth as butter.  It reminds me of a lot barbershop scents but it’s actually a woody oriental. There’s far too many, spices, and the leather is quite prominent, along with myrrh, and a little smoke. I don’t get much honey on my skin which is a great. Regardless, this is a great one for the colder months.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1045187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1045187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1043382" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1043382" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andy the Frenchy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165781.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andy the Frenchy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1043382ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1043382" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781">Andy the Frenchy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-21">03/21/19 17:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Clean, crisp, elegant.<br />
<br />
What I expect a niche shaving foam to smell like. It has definitively a barbershop vibe, but feels modern. It could be considered a 21st century fougere: indeed the fougere-defining lavender and oakmoss notes are present, but Duchaufour smartly substituted the citrus top notes by aldehydic, watery and metallic notes to make it feel very contemporary: simply genius! I confirm this shares similarities with Chanel PE and MMM At The Barber's.<br />
The honey brings a hint of manliness, without making this one feel animalistic at any time.<br />
<br />
Just a masterpiece, in my humble opinion.<br />
<br />
I suggest to wear it in Spring and Fall days, to 30+ crowds. (or 20+ dandy)<br />
<br />
Edit: the honeyed woody base is just heaven. Very long lasting as a subtle scent on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1043382"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1043382#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1043301" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1043301" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tayyabforyouth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1124219"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1124219.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tayyabforyouth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Colonia-Club-31424.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31424.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Colonia Club"title="Colonia Club"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1043301ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1043301" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1124219">tayyabforyouth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-21">03/21/19 12:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells literally like a niche version of Brut aftershave. The notes to my nose are lavender, metal, beeswax, and oakmoss (especially lavender and oakmoss) with mint in the background. It's very gentlemanly, old-school, and nice. Projection and longevity are both solid.<br />
<br />
4/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1043301"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1043301#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1042498" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1042498" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Isomies"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182455"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1182455.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Isomies" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Santa-Maria-Novella/Vetiver-11459.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11459.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vetiver"title="Vetiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1042498ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1042498" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182455">Isomies</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-19">03/19/19 01:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sartorial sweet honey and smoke I combined with Santa Maria novella Peau D'Espagne. Oh man, what a combination of leather, smoke, tar and liquorice! I've been mixing a lot of leathery brands together, trying to find a perfect cedurer of the mind, total match, no result until I tried these two legendary brands. This is the match, like Dior Homme Perfume 2014 by itself, they cannot been beaten!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1042498"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1042498#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1033490" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1033490" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Professor Value"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171228"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1171228.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Professor Value" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nicolai-Parfumeur-Createur/New-York-Intense-28180.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28180.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="New York Intense"title="New York Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1033490ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1033490" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171228">Professor Value</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-02-20">02/20/19 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Here's my recommendation: You should have either Penhaligon's Sartorial or Maison Margiela's At The Barber in your cologne collection. These are so close that I believe one or the other doesn't add much to the mix. I'm guessing that whichever one you start with first, you'll fall in love, and then after getting the other, you'll prefer the one you've been using. I like them both, but I've had At the Barber for several months, sampled Sartorial, and concluded, based on price and scent, I'll just stick with the one I have.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1033490"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1033490#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1020844" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1020844" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Forever Neil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1155359"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1155359.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Forever Neil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Arrogance/Arrogance-Pour-Homme-6490.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6490.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Arrogance Pour Homme"title="Arrogance Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1020844ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1020844" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1155359">Forever Neil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-15">01/15/19 10:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>F2097, there is something extremely antiseptic about Sartorial. I can't pinpoint it but it made me nauseous. It was the only cologne that ever made me throw up. I wish I could pinpoint it, and I've been trying to compare it to something I've smelled before. It sort of reminds me of a cheap mouthwash, but that's not exactly it. One day, I will read the reviews and somebody will come up with the answer. I'm very much looking forward to that day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1020844"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1020844#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1020832" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1020832" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1020832ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1020832" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-15">01/15/19 09:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a good perfume but for years I've been a bit not sure about Sartorial. <br />
<br />
I think it is very generic. Although it is better made, it is too simular to something cheap, normal and boring. This could totally be a supermarket own label mens body spray. <br />
<br />
The composition has some of the same stuff going on as lothair and endymion. But it is less effective and less interesting than both of those. It also feels like Floris' JF but with the orange taken out.<br />
<br />
It is metallic in a cosy way. Metallic scents never normally feel this warm. That is probably the most interesting thing about sartorial. <br />
<br />
The scent does fit it's marketing notes too. As well as woods and flowers you can get fabric and sewing machine out of it. The dust and wooden panels of an old gentlemens tailor.<br />
<br />
The side products are/were pretty good. I liked the shower gel and deodorant enough to rebuy until they got discontinued. I believe you can still get the shaving products. I never got to try the soap before it went. Penhaligons have a horrible habit of discontinuing all their good soaps and leaving us with the average ones.<br />
<br />
In the Penhaligons range this took up the attention of the fougere niche from English Fern. Although sartorial is more complex than English Fern, it is less interesting, more generic and just bad in comparison.<br />
<br />
The bad side of Sartorial is that it has a slight whiff of Pepto-Bismol. It can be cloying too and is one of the less wearable Penhaligons mainstream scents.<br />
<br />
English Fern is a timeless classic; simple, bold, well made. All of the side products for English Fern got replaced by inferior Sartorial ones. <br />
<br />
During 2018 all the Sartorial ones now seem to be going and being replaced by Halfeti ones. The cycle continues and once again while Halfeti is perfectly fine, it's products are inferior to the Sartorial ones. <br />
<br />
Although this time around it is because Penhaligons are going cheap and nasty on the formulas rather than the scent. The showergel is watered down, the body lotion is cheap foreign made rubbish and all the deodorants are gone.<br />
<br />
I think I've been quite dismissive of Sartorial in this review. It does have redeeming qualities and in products that aren't perfume it is quite nice. <br />
<br />
However it is probably the least essential current Penhaligons perfume. I barely use it and only have the small size bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1020832"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1020832#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1018000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1018000" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Luna_J"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/844277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.844277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Luna_J" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Vetiver-69.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vetiver"title="Vetiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1018000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1018000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/844277">Luna_J</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-07">01/07/19 18:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There really is a delightful illusion of aged wood (not ‘woods’ as in abstract woody notes but the actual smell of old paneling &amp; planks...) in the opening of Sartorial. Well-blended base notes like cedar, patchouli and myrrh mingle with a strong impression of moss to suggest a finely layered olfactory patina. <br />
<br />
Cresting above this worldliness is a fresh (but not “fresh”) aldehydic-citric lift to the fougère accord calling card of wafting lavender and ringing bergamot; the aldehydes, maybe with the tang of a little ginger, really do hint at a metallic tang for a bit, and the combination of this cheering scintillation with the warm, buffed ‘beeswax’ accord produces an especially convincing sensation for the first hour of being well-groomed and refreshed yet familiar and secure...I momentarily felt as if my scarf and overcoat were brand new, that I'd just had an expensive haircut, and that an extensive skin care regimen was part of my morning routine (none of which is true I assure you...) <br />
<br />
Holding this all together are musks; I’m actually surprised that 'musk' does not receive more credit in the votes so far, as I think it contributes mightily to the beeswax-and-steam-press illusion. Similarly, coumarin is huge here: the biscuitty-nutty sweetness is very obvious and central in its supporting role, and serves both to ground the fougère accord and to lead into the sweetened heart and base where this fragrance’s identity continues to shift...To wit: Sartorial is *not really* 'Brut with better materials' (unlike Brut it does not rely much on tart citrus, floral ylang, or the 'powdery effect' of  white flowers); it is not even (really) all that 'barbershoppy', in that it does not depend on a bright, clean opening suggesting a slap of stinging hygiene, following the tradition of barbershop classics like Brut's forefather, Pinaud Clubman, nor are there camphorous accents like clove to hint at medicinal astringency. <br />
<br />
Sartorial feels instead more pared down and laid back, a contemporary minimalist apartment idea of cozy. Whomever came up with the tailor’s shop conceit, with its notions of the softly brushed nap of bespoke suiting fabrics, was being very clever but perhaps a little cynical as well, as Sartorial is IMO a high-quality exemplar of an already popular post-modern sub-genre: the freshly-laundered-fougère. This comparison will probably annoy some people, but the immediate reference point for me was cheaper fragrances aimed at younger guys like Burberry Touch or Versace's The Dreamer (both nice compositions in their way), with the real parent of the genre being Gaultier's Le Male... The combining of the comforting lavender-tonka aspects of a traditional fougère with an increased reliance of the vanilla sweetness of the tonka supported by synthetics reminiscent of a soft, fluffy drier sheet dominate the second and third hours of a wearing of Sartorial, so much so that I could even sense the ‘sweet spot’ of Le Male’s ancient ancestor, Caron Pour un Homme, in the mingling of lavender, coumarin, vanilla and musk as this scent goes to ground. It should be said that though both Touch and Le Male are popular mid-grade designer scents, Sartorial smells more expensive: the woody base is more thoughtfully textured, and a hint of the opening bergamot lasts surprisingly far into the drydown; plus, by the time it has finished, Sartorial has undergone one final – and notable – transformation...<br />
<br />
I admit it snuck up on me... As we all know, base notes do not really ‘appear’ so much as become excavated as the more fugitive sensations of lighter notes evaporate. I thought that Sartorial had settled on a base of musk, moss, tonka, and synthetic woods, so I had to stop and sniff my wrist repeatedly when to my surprise I smelled a very natural and prominent powdery patchouli facet emerge... Not just any patchouli either, but, chapter and verse, the lavender-coumarin-rosewood-patchouli-vanilla combination that fills out the sweetly malted tobacco-toned base of Davidoff Zino. This trace accord persists for several hours, and is, if you know Zino well, unmistakeable. This is good news for fans of the discontinued Davidoff scent that miss its particularly companionable skin scent, and adds some mellow gravitas to Sartorial's sweet and synthetic aspects, suggesting that, fabric softener notes notwithstanding, it had hidden depths rooted in 1980's iterations of sensuality in the barbershop. It's interesting to think that two celebrated stabs at the postmodern fougère -- Sartorial and Tom Ford's Beau de Jour -- both reference a ghost of Zino that, though once thought to be discontinued, lives on as a relative cheapie and in the hearts of many a lovable, rugged minor classic.<br />
<br />
IMHO, Sartorial is a great scent for someone who is interested in the idea of something ‘old school’ and ‘masculine’, albeit with quotation marks firmly but tastefully in place. It strikes me as being an ideal ‘mature’ cologne for a college grad or young professional who feels they are ready for the next stage of their lives but have not acquired the patina (or maybe the desire) for something weighted with either heavy presence or a specific history. It certainly feels handsome, contemporary and maybe a little calculatedly well-groomed. Not quite my thing, but very nice nonetheless.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1018000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1018000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1012135" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1012135" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LadyPilot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/709807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.709807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LadyPilot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lolita-Lempicka/Mon-Eau-48837.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48837.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Eau"title="Mon Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1012135ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1012135" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/709807">LadyPilot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-21">12/21/18 11:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent certainly deserves an elaborate comment for which I'm not quite ready after the very first sniff from the cap. However, it did manage to steal my heart.<br />
It's the lavender and the timeless leather and metallic notes with a hint of vanilla which make it more than just a classic - rather a legend. Knowing that it was the last scent that a Dear Friend of my family wore gives the scent some extra value in my heart.<br />
I'll make sure to try it again when I have the chance to do so. It's one of the scents than a man might take on a journey in a Time Machine. Whenever he'd land, the scent would be just fine!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1012135"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1012135#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1008543" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1008543" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Forever Neil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1155359"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1155359.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Forever Neil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Arrogance/Arrogance-Pour-Homme-6490.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6490.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Arrogance Pour Homme"title="Arrogance Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1008543ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1008543" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1155359">Forever Neil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-10">12/10/18 10:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This spicy, woody fragrance is way too obnoxious for me. I also like dirty fragrances, and this is a dirty fragrance. I'm a big fan of barbershop scents as well. I like Paco Rabanne Pour Homme a lot, as I'd consider that a dirty barbershop scent. I get why people like Santorial, but there are better barbershop scents out there like YSL Rive Gauche or even from a lot of these artisans like Ariana and Evans. I own over 30 barbershop fragrances with my current favorite being Alt Innsbruck or Ted Baker Grooming Room (only sold by Nordstrom online). I can understand why someone may like this fragrance, but Paco Rabanne Pour Homme does a much better job in this category. This fragrance is more in the Egoiste Platinum spicy category, although the scent is different. The spicy burn through the nose is similar. I'm having a difficult time categorizing this fragrance. For me, the best Penthaligon's is Juniper Sling by a wide margin, but Juniper Sling has a gin and tonic vibe to it.<br />
<br />
If you enjoy cheap aftershaves such as Brut, then this is a step up.<br />
⭐</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1008543"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1008543#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1001546" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1001546" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="steppx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885985"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.885985.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="steppx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1001546ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1001546" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885985">steppx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-16">11/16/18 15:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I notice a lot of comments suggesting classy, masculine, elegant, etc. And it does seem to be the message of this scent. Very much a dignified and distinguished message. I found it very attractive, though Im not sure I would wear it that often. Im not even sure for the reasons, because it is very well made and balanced -- but maybe its the dry down where it sort of loses me a little. Also the performance is only average. Maybe longevity is a bit above average. Its not bad, though. The metalic saville row note is clear and it gives the whole thing a quality of aristocratic distinction.  It is not however all THAT special. And it does have a barbershop subtext....though a very expensive barbershop in Luxembourg or , well, London. its not sexy in any overt way. Its restrained and refined and one of the better fourgere scents of recent memory. But its not a classic and in spite of wanting to love it, I don't. But it also smells different on different people, Ive noticed. The dry down gets rather boring and tedious feeling. But its overall an offbeat sort of man-of-distinction scent, and indeed its very English too. This wouldnt be something made by a paris house i dont think.  The violet comes through after about a half hour and its really nice and kind of relaxing. I sort of wish i could find a great violet, but i havent yet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="1001546"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=1001546#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent987515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc987515" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GustaveTheNose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1015635"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1015635.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GustaveTheNose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Gold-Man-918.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.918.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold Man"title="Gold Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma987515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd987515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1015635">GustaveTheNose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-02">10/02/18 19:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very good offering from penhaligons, very masculine and serves as a reminder of the 80s. <br />
<br />
Mature, classy, manly, and chic. It feels like it's been done alot in the past, but still smells great. <br />
<br />
To me it's mostly lavender, metal, aldehydes, Oak moss, patchouli, and black pepper. Has some sweetness too, maybe the neroli or honey. Although honey is mentioned it doesn't smell strong, nothing like back to black for example. <br />
<br />
Full bottle worthy of you like mature and chic perfumes from the 80s.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="987515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=987515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent986452" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc986452" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellme11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1070151.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellme11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Empire-des-Indes-72955.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72955.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Empire des Indes"title="Empire des Indes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma986452ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd986452" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151">smellme11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-29">09/29/18 16:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know why it's taken me nearly two years to finally write a review for one of my favorite perfumes. I believe this is the best offering from the house of Penhaligon's that I have tested to date (disclaimer:  I haven't tried anything from the "portraits" line or after). I had read about Sartorial before purchasing and was rather scared that the over abundance of notes might prove to be a mess, but I was more than thrilled when the sample arrived and I ended up purchasing a full bottle. This may well be a masterpiece as so many other reviewers have stated. For me, it's been a bit hit-and-miss with Bertrand Douchaufour. When he goes off into his ultra powdery directions, I get off the train. Thankfully, this scent does not veer off into  powderland, and I am so very grateful. This is a carefully crafted concoction utilizing a heavy number of quality ingredients. As I mentioned earlier, with all of the notes listed, this could quite well have turned into a train wreck. What happens when I smell Sartorial is sublime: I instantly feel relaxed, less stressed, safe and caressed. Somehow, this modern chamber orchestra of notes, coagulates into a binary fragrance consisting of freshly laundered cotton clothing that has been machine-dried with lavender-scented dryer sheets...paired with melted honey-vanilla candle wax. The opening has a somewhat marine/aquatic tint for 15 minutes or so. Projection and longevity are high on this one. If you overdo it with the sprayer, your friends will not complain....they will be instantly bewitched too.  I am not understanding the "metal" note other reviewers have mentioned....conceptually, it seems very abstract to me. What kind of metal? I have no olfactory reference point. Is it hot metal or cold metal? iron, stainless steel, nickel, what? Perhaps it is a "machine oil" accord that is causing these references? I have some machine oil that I use on my electric hair buzzer. Machine oil is also used for sewing machines. I believe that may be the link to the ambiguous "metallic" note, and it inadvertently confirms the popular notion of this fragrance belonging in the "barbershop" scent category. In closing, can I just say that all you need is one squirt on the neck, and you are good to go.I suggest not going overboard with Sartorial, 2 squirts, well ok, but 3 squirts is pushing it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="986452"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=986452#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent981216" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc981216" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zuma_Moon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1065247"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1065247.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zuma_Moon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/French-Lover-1022.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1022.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="French Lover"title="French Lover"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma981216ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd981216" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1065247">Zuma_Moon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-12">09/12/18 13:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favourites from the Penhaligon's line. I love the modern formal masculine vibe this creates, it really is a modern masterpiece in my opinion. <br />
<br />
I love how Bertrand Duchaufour has artistically recreated the smell of a tailors workshop. The use of the metallic note is genius and creates the image of sewing machines working away crafting luxurious tailored suits perfectly. Many perfumers try but fail to create a desired image through scent but this succeeds exceptionally well. <br />
<br />
Longevity is above average with good projection. I use 4 sprays which lasts around 8 hours. Projection is strong for the first 3 hours then remains with subtle projection.<br />
<br />
One for the refined dressed up gent.<br />
<br />
8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="981216"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=981216#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent980248" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc980248" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OllyWolly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="OllyWolly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma980248ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd980248" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133716">OllyWolly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-09">09/09/18 14:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is to Brut like GIT is to Cool Water - the classier, more refined sibling. My grandfather used to wear Brut and when I smelled Satirical, it brought back a lot of memories<br />
<br />
Admittedly I'm basing this comparison off a memory of Brut 25+ years ago and I'm sure that side by side they would be nothing alike, however this brought back that memory.<br />
<br />
Not something I wear often, however very glad I have it in my collection. I generally wear it when dressed up more formally.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="980248"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=980248#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent979007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc979007" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kndy38"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/619912"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kndy38" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pacific-Chill-81423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Chill"title="Pacific Chill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma979007ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd979007" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/619912">kndy38</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-05">09/05/18 14:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Masculine, clean and creamy is how I would describe this one.<br />
<br />
It does last quite a bit and is very polite.<br />
<br />
Definitely signature worthy for a 40+ male.<br />
I'll stick to Endymion or Lothair instead :)<br />
<br />
8/10 for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="979007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=979007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent972879" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc972879" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Le Knows"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089925"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089925.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Le Knows" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maurer-Wirtz/Tabac-Original-28000.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28000.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tabac Original"title="Tabac Original"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma972879ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd972879" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089925">Le Knows</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-18">08/18/18 08:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sartorial reaches the heights of creativity in masculine perfumery. Introducing notes from a tailor's cutting room is no mere novelty. Not only are those olfactory cues a faithful nod to Savile Row, it just plain smells fantastic. Master Perfumer Duchaufour riffs on the theme and elevates Sartorial to Masterpiece status. Penhaligon's Sartorial is nuanced and of high-quality, smelling both sophisticated and delicious. Brilliant!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="972879"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=972879#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent963769" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc963769" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="echo4kilo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153785.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="echo4kilo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Room-237-30364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Room 237"title="Room 237"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma963769ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd963769" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-20">07/20/18 13:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sartorial is one of my favorite fragrances ever. I first heard about it on Micheal Malice's show "Your Welcome". I believe he says he wears it often. I bought a bottle and love it. It is the fragrance I wear when dressing up. It makes me feel so much more confident. When I smell it, I can smell the wax/honey smell and the metallic scent is there and it makes my mouth water. It reminds me a bit of Brute, but its so much better. One of the best parts is it makes you feel so classy for such a low cost.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="963769"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=963769#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent944550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc944550" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nooshin (Atghia)"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1117977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nooshin (Atghia)" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caron/Aimez-Moi-2816.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2816.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aimez - Moi"title="Aimez - Moi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma944550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd944550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1117977">Nooshin (Atghia)</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-19">05/19/18 23:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sartorial comes from the Modern Latin word sartor which means "tailor," literally " one who patches and mends. My brother look for one fragrance instead of “Brut by Faberge” and finally bought Sartorial. One of the most popular Penhaligon’s scent by Mr. Duchaufour. Classic, Fougere, Alcoholic barbershop smell. Absolutely Masculine &amp; pleasure. Like a middle-aged men who wear three-piece suit in 30 years ago. I like its complex smell that focus on mix of lavender, metallic note &amp; soft leather accord in start. And some spices specially black pepper in contrast with sweet tonka obviously in middle till end. Formal wearable choice for men in spring/ fall usage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="944550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=944550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent943785" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc943785" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="richmilton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1020788"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1020788.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="richmilton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Heritage-Eau-de-Toilette-1880.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1880.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Heritage Eau de Toilette"title="Heritage Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma943785ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd943785" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1020788">richmilton</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-17">05/17/18 15:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really impressed with this one. I do get the vintage Brut comparison but this is much, much classier. Keep in mind I'm talking vintage bruth (60's to mid 80's) not the cheap stuff out today. <br />
<br />
This is class in a bottle. That's probably why I don't see me wearing this in casual settings, it definitely is for more formal events, romantic dates, weddings, upscale corporate events, and anything that requires a suit and tie or at least a sport jacket. Although I suppose semi-casual is fine... but a crisp, clean, iron pressed button down is recommended. But again, that's just me. I enjoy wearing fragrances that match my attire on different occasions based on the season.<br />
<br />
The reviewer below me @ian85 called this "Manly but not macho" and that sums up this tamed masculine beast perfectly! Definitely has that classic barbershop vibe, like you just got a hot towel wet shave at a high class barbershop. If you want to smell like a classy gentleman buy this. Perfect for the Spring season. Love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="10559"comment_id="943785"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html?ccid=943785#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="10559" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>

</div>
